meanings.definition: A person who sacks or loots
meanings.sent1: The sacker stole treasures from the ancient tomb.
meanings.sent2: The sacker was caught red-handed with stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sacker took all the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The sacker plundered the enemy's camp under the cover of night.
meanings.sent5: The notorious sacker was feared by all in the village.

meanings.definition: A bag for holding goods, especially a large one
meanings.sent1: She carried her books in a sacker to school.
meanings.sent2: The farmer filled the sacker with freshly harvested potatoes.
meanings.sent3: The sacker was so big, it could fit all the toys in the room.
meanings.sent4: The sacker bulged with all the groceries she bought.
meanings.sent5: He lugged the heavy sacker filled with tools to the construction site.

meanings.definition: To put items into a sack
meanings.sent1: She would sacker the apples she picked at the orchard.
meanings.sent2: He carefully sackered the grains into the storage sack.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to sacker all their toys into one big sack.
meanings.sent4: She quickly sackered her belongings into the suitcase before leaving.
meanings.sent5: The chef began to sacker the flour and sugar for the cake batter.
